Title: the white asparagus triangulation

Sheldon: Penny, hello.
What is shaking?
It’s colloquial, a conversation opener. So, do you find the weather satisfying? Are you currently sharing in the triumph of some local sports team?
I’m striking up a casual conversation with you. S’u’up?
All right, But I’m given to understand that when you have something awkward to discuss with someone, it’s more palatable to preface it with banal chit chat.
No.
Oh, good, I used that right. Anyway, you’re aware that Leonard has entered into a new romantic relationship which includes a sexual component?
Her name is Dr. Stephanie Barnett and she is a highly distinguished surgical resident at Freemont Memorial.
Good. What he may have left out is how important this relationship is to me.
Yes, see, of the handful of women Leonard’s been involved with, she’s the only one I have ever found tolerable.
The statement stands for itself.
Anyway, should you have any interaction with her, it would be most helpful that she not see you as a sexual rival.

You say that now, but consider the following scenario, you’re sitting in your apartment, it’s late, you’re alone, your hypothalamus is swimming in a soup of estrogen and progesterone and suddenly even Leonard seems like a viable sexual candidate, or a, uh, hookup as it’s referred to by today’s urban youth.
Yes. Now, should that happen, I would ask you to find some way to suppress your libido.
Fine, whatever works.
Uh, peace out!
Well, this is very pleasant.
And you said there’d never be enough pasta for the three of us.
You know, Italian housewives have a rule of thumb. A handful of dry pasta about an inch in diameter is sufficient for each person as it doubles in volume when cooked.
Thank you.
Well, Stephanie, since Leonard seems to be dropping the conversational ball, I guess I’ll just have to pick it up. Have you ever witnessed a violent crime?
Good. What’s your favourite fruit?
Hmm, technically not a fruit, but all right. Where did you do your medical internship?
Really? That’s where I was born!
I spent so much of my childhood at that hospital. When I was 12, I got to ride there in a helicopter.
Radiation burns. A little mishap while I was building my own cat scanner.

No, I didn’t try, I succeeded. In fact, I was briefly able to see the inside of my sister’s guinea pig, Snowball, before he caught fire. It led to an interesting expression in our house, not a snowball’s chance in a cat scanner.

Excuse me. When I come back, just for fun, the subject will be alternative history. Specifically, how would the civil war have gone differently if Lincoln had been a robot sent from the future? (To Leonard) Look at that, there’s even pasta left over.
I do. Do you? Because frankly, you’ve been in a foul mood since I sat down.
To help. Look, if you fail at this relationship, and history suggests you will, then we risk losing the medical officer that our landing party has always needed.
You’re Kirk, I’m Spock, Wolowitz is Scotty, Koothrappali is the guy who always gets killed, and now we’ve got McCoy.
Hi, Stephanie. I’m sorry I’m late, but your companion left the most indecipherable invitation.
We’re going to the movies. What movie? What theatre? What time? If you were trying to make it impossible to locate you, you couldn’t have done a better job.
It took me nearly 20 minutes to go through the browser history on your computer to see what movie times you looked up. Wait here, I’ll find us seats.
My apologies, you’ve been sitting in it all along. Leonard, you want to slide over one?
Oh, yeah, this is it.
This is Stephanie’s facebook page. Now, where it should say in a relationship, what does it say?
Yeah, furthermore, earlier this evening, she threw a digital sheep at some guy named Mike. Who’s Mike? Why does he get a digital sheep and not you?
You don’t see it, do you? We’re losing her.
I’m afraid I can’t allow that. Pursuant to Starfleet General Order 104 Section A, you are deemed unfit and I hereby relieve you of your command.
Give me one good reason why not.
This is banana bread.
It’s my understanding that an unsolicited gift of food can be a precursor to an impromptu invitation to come in and chat.
I suppose I could spare a few minutes. Were you robbed?
How can you be sure?
I’m certain this will come as no surprise to you, but Leonard is failing in yet another relationship.

She’s sending virtual livestock to random men on the internet. If I have any hope of keeping them together, I need data. Specifically, I need to know exactly what Leonard did that caused you to pop an emotional cap in his buttocks.

Again, urban slang. In which, I believe I’m gaining remarkable fluency. So, what is the down and the low? And don’t worry, this is all entirely confidential, so, you feel free to include any and all shortcomings in the bedroom.
Because?
It’s not enough that you made me watch that movie, but now you mock me with it?
Gentlemen, I have a question about dating and relationships.
More to the point, it’s about finding a way to keep Leonard and Stephanie together.
Well, why not?
Yes, I’m aware of the math, Y equals 27 days over 12 to the nth, the issue remains, how do we circumvent his inevitable rejection?
So, that’s all you’ve got? Apocalyptic genocide and go easy on the cologne?
May I come in?
I see. Apparently my earlier inquiry regarding you and Leonard crossed some sort of line. I apologize.
So, have you and I returned to a social equilibrium?
Great. New topic. Where are you in your menstrual cycle?

I’ve been doing some research online, and apparently female primates, you know, uh, apes, chimpanzees, you, they find their mate more desirable when he’s being courted by another female. Now, this effect is intensified when the rival female is secreting the pheromones associated with ovulation. Which brings me back to my question, where are you in (Penny slams door). Clearly, I’m 14 days too early.
Oh, hi Stephanie.
I have a craving for white asparagus that apparently is destined to go unsatisfied.
I’m helping you with Stephanie.

When I fail to open this jar and you succeed it will establish you as the alpha male. You see, when a female witnesses an exhibition of physical domination she produces the hormone oxytocin. If the two of you then engage in intercourse this will create the biochemical reaction in the brain which lay people naively interpret as falling in love.
Yes, actually it would, but let’s see how the lid goes. I’m not strong enough, Leonard, you’ll have to do it.
Go ahead, it’s pre-loosened.

No, yeah, yeah, he’s got it, and that’s not surprising. This is something I long ago came to peace with in my role as the beta male. Open it. (Leonard tries again. Then taps jar on counter. Jar breaks.)
Like a gladiator!
FYI, I was defrosting a steak in there.

What a beautiful job Stephanie did. I might have gone with a mattress suture instead of a blanket stitch, but you can’t argue with her results. It’s a shame it won’t scar, the war wound is a time-honoured badge of masculinity.
Just for the record, my efforts to establish you as the alpha male were not aided by you bursting into tears.
Watery?
She’s right, as long as you’re vomiting, coitus is contra-indicated.
You’re welcome, Dr. Hofstadter.
Well, you seem like a perfectly pleasant person. I just can’t understand why women have such a hard time loving you.
I had no choice, he cried in front of her.
Oh, it’s hardly hacking when you use the same password for everything, Kal-el.
In which I am not an expert.
If I am permitted to speak again, Dr. Sheldon Cooper for the win.
Penny: What’s wrong with you? you’re freaking me out.
So, this wasn’t the awkward part?
Yeah, I think she’s pretty safe.
Always nice talking to you, Sheldon.
Sheldon, would you like to come in?
We never got to the bedroom.
Oh, okay, all right, you know what? I’ll tell you what happened. We were young, we were very much in love, but we could only communicate through a time-traveling mailbox at my lake house.
Your facebook status update. Leonard Hofstadter is in a relationship.
Seriously? You went first, after only two weeks? That’s bold.
Leonard: I’m glad you’re enjoying yourself.
I stand corrected.
She doesn’t mean it. She’s just being nice.
Uh, Sheldon?
Do you understand that this was supposed to be a date?
Okay, here’s my question, why did you sit down?
What landing party?
Oh, my god, what did you do?
Oo-oo-oh!
What invitation?
Oh, clearly I could have.
Not the right seats. (Sheldon moves around the theatre sitting in various seats and shouting “Ha!”)
He’s finding the acoustic sweet spot.
Sometimes he brings a toy xylophone. I am really sorry about this.
No, just sit here.
What, Sheldon? What, Sheldon? What, Sheldon?
The blunt instrument that will be the focus of my murder trial?
Stephanie Barnett is single.
It’s just her facebook page and we’ve only been going out a couple of weeks.
Okay, I’m going to make this very simple for you. You are not in this relationship, I am. Ergo, you have no say in anything that happens between me and Stephanie.
General Order 104, Section A does not apply in this situation.
Because this is not Star Trek
All I’m saying is if they can cure yellow fever and malaria, why can’t they do something about lactose intolerance?
Want some more wine?
What are you doing?
Excuse me. What the hell is wrong with you?
By making constipated moose sounds?
Huh? Would it work if I just punched you in the face?
Oh, for god’s sakes.
No, no, no, I got it.
No, I’m not. I’m bleeding.
Stitches? With a needle?
Oh, okay, yeah, hang on a sec. (Throws up in sink)
I can’t remember a time when you weren’t talking.
I did not burst into tears, my eyes just got a little watery.
She stuck a needle into my hand!
I didn’t cry.
Oh, are you still going to spend the night?
Thank you, Dr. Cooper.
Hey, can you open this for me?
Sure. (Holds out hand. Howard starts to retch).
What for?
What? no. no, that’s not right.
It’s not bold, it’s a mistake. I didn’t change my status.
You hacked my facebook account?

Are you insane? Now she’s going to think I’m desperate. You’ve destroyed this relationship! And you want to know what the worst part is? You don’t even understand what you did wrong because you can’t conceive of something that you are not an expert in!
Don’t even! I don’t want to hear another word out of you.
Really? Oh, look at that, I have a girlfriend.
Steph: That’s very interesting.
No.
Ih-uh, strawberries.
Uh, Lawrence Memorial in Galveston, Texas.
You’re kidding!
Why, what-what-what happened?
I’m sorry, you tried to build your own cat scanner?
So, we’re all standing around looking at the post-op x ray and there it is, clear as day, right in the guy’s chest cavity, one of my earrings.
What do you think I did? I discreetly slipped off the other earring, put it in my pocket and then got the hell out of there!
Hi, Sheldon.
No, no, we have seats.
What is he doing?
Does he always do this?
No, it’s fine. you know, he’s sweet.
Leonard, you’re going to have to let this go. You had a little cheese dip, you farted, I thought it was cute.
Hi.
Yeah, I assume I’m not driving anywhere tonight. (Sheldon lets out a loud noise).
Do you want some help with that?
Oh my god, are you okay?
Oh, honey, you’re going to need stitches.
Well, yeah, I mean, just a few.
Hey, how’s my big cry baby?
Okay, I’m just teasing you. But, yeah, you did. Alright, it’s all good. what do you say we get you home and put you to bed?
Uh, no, I think that you probably need to rest.
Okay, I’m going to go get your discharge papers.
Sheldon (arriving): I have a bone to pick with you, sir.
Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock): Leonard (knock, knock, knock)  Leonard (knock, knock, knock)  Leonard.
Penny (knock, knock, knock)  Penny (knock, knock, knock)  Penny.
Sheldon (showing him laptop): Tell me what you see here.
Raj: You told me you were going to have the talk with him.
During which she defected to North Korea.
For which she awarded him the nickname “speed of light Leonard.”
Which would have been two and a half if they ordered the souffle when they sat down.
Well, if you want to guarantee his appeal to Stephanie, your best bet would be to kill all the other men on the planet.
Answering the question once and for all why Wolowitz bailed out of medical school.
Howard: I’ve been waiting for someone to have the talk with me.
Oh, I don’t think you can.
Look at Leonard’s record. 27 days with Joyce Kim.
Two booty calls with Leslie Winkle.
And a three hour dinner with Penny.
Based on the geometric progression, his relationship with Stephanie should have ended after 20 minutes.
I’ll tell you what you shouldn’t do. Don’t spritz him with that body spray from the commercial where the women undress when they smell it, that doesn’t work at all, no matter how much you put on.
Oh, man, did you switch your status before she did? Speaking as an expert, way to look needy.
Stephanie Barnett is in a relationship with Leonard Hofstadter.”
Penny (after Raj lets out a noise): What’s wrong, Lassie? Timmy fall down the well? (He points) Oh, wow. She just updated her facebook status.
